title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Thursday 14 December 2017 - BBC News
summary: hgv driver jailed for fatal 'porn ' crash .
further snow leads to disruption on peak district routes .
broadmarsh car park and bus station plans revealed .
ww2 relic to be demolished for play area .
rugby : nottingham boss set to join wasps .

documents.title: your bag 's journey through the airport
text: your bag 's journey through the airport

documents.title: killer lorry driver was watching porn
text: killer lorry driver was watching porn

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: our live updates have now ended , but some news , sport and travel will continue to appear automatically overnight .
dedicated live coverage from east midlands live resumes at 08:00 tomorrow .

documents.title: weather : some snow around overnight
text: showers will move in this evening and continue overnight , these will mostly fall as rain and sleet at lower levels .
however some snow is likely for a time over higher ground .
there will be plenty of clear spells between the showers which will allow temperatures to drop and brings the risk of ice on untreated surfaces .
minimum temperatures of 1c ( 34f ) in urban areas .
author: Anna Church
BBC East Midlands Today weather presenter

documents.title: six charged with human trafficking
text: a father and his two sons are among six people who have been arrested on sus of running brothels in the east midlands .
police made the arrests in derby , beeston and strelley on tuesday , for offences believed to have taken place between 2013-17 .
the group were also charged with human trafficking offences and will appear before nottingham crown court in the new year .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: weather warning issued
text: once again , there is a yellow weather warning in place for ice across the east midlands .
ice is likely to be a hazard from now until 11:00 on friday
author: Anna Church
BBC East Midlands Today weather presenter

documents.title: dirty fish and chip shop shut down
text: this filthy fish and chip shop has been closed down because of hygiene failures and claims of food poisoning from customers .
gary and vincent bailey , co-owners of bailey 's fish bar in kegworth , admitted nine food hygiene offences and have been banned from operating any kind of food business .
the pair were both fined £ 400 and ordered to pay £ 4,282 in costs .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: hgv driver jailed for fatal 'porn ' crash
text: a driver , who was watching pornographic material on his mobile phone , has been jailed for causing death by dangerous driving .
felix gillon , 56 , of johnson road , bedworth , was driving along the m69 in leicestershire when his hgv crashed into another driver 's truck .
the victim , kerry pemberton , had broken down and was waiting for a recovery vehicle on the hard shoulder between junctions one and two .
after the crash gillon threw his mobile phone into the fields near the road , police said .
he was sentenced to eight years in jail for causing death by dangerous driving and for perverting the course of justice .
gillon has also been banned from driving for eight years .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: british fed cup player rae retires
text: british fed cup player rae retires

documents.title: retiring rae 'excited for the future '
text: retiring rae 'excited for the future '

documents.title: care home worker jailed for historic child sex abuse
text: a man has been jailed for 40 months for historic child sex offences against three young girls .
andrew wilson , 62 , of baslow road , bakewell , was found guilty of nine offences of sexual assault against the girls who were all under the age of 16 at the time .
derby crown court heard how wilson 's crimes took place between 1977-85 .
det con nicky ward , from derbyshire police , said : `` andrew wilson was in a position of trust at the care home which was a position he abused .
`` the girls he assaulted were young and vulnerable . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: travel : crash causes delays on a52
text: traffic is building up on the a52 near radcliffe-on-trent because of an accident .
there are queues towards the saxondale roundabout .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: jury sent home at trial of derby terror suspect
text: the jury in the trial of a couple accused of plotting an islamic state-inspired attack on britain with a home-made bomb or deadly ricin poison has been sent home for the night .
munir mohammed , of leopold street , derby and rowaida el-hassan , from london , both deny preparing terrorist acts between november 2015 and december 2016 .
the judge , michael topolski qc , had sent the jury out to begin its deliberations at 12:45 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: rare gold richard iii coin sells for £ 40k
text: a rare gold coin which may have been dropped by one of richard iii 's soldiers fleeing from the battle of bosworth has fetched more than £ 40,000 at an auction .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: line up for strictly tour finalised
text: the final celebrities have been announced for next year 's strictly come dancing tour .
loughborough-based paralympian jonnie peacock , who trained for the tv series in leicester , joins susan calman , davood ghadami , gemma atkinson , alexandra burke , joe mcfadden and debbie mcgee .
the tour , which begins in january , visits nottingham 's arena for two shows in early february .
author: Press Association

documents.title: lane closed on m1 after breakdown
text: this is the scene on the m1 southbound at j26 right now .
one lane 's closed following a breakdown .
highways england said things should be back to normal by 16:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: emergency road closure in rainworth
text: something to be aware of if you 're in the area .
the # a617 near # rainworth is closed in both directions due to concerns for a person 's safety .
we have a crew from # blidworth and crew from # mansfield on the scene supporting @ twitterid avoid the area if possible .
update to follow .
# oneteam
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: man 's struggle over alcoholic mother
text: man 's struggle over alcoholic mother

documents.title: see how your primary school is doing
text: see how your primary school is doing

documents.title: jockey gets ban for betting breach
text: jockey hayley turner has been given a three-month ban by the british horseracing authority ( bha ) for a breach of betting rules .
british flat racing 's most successful female jockey staked 164 bets - at a profit of £ 160 - over 18 months .
turner , 34 , from nottingham , retired in 2015 but kept her licence , so the bets technically placed her in breach of the rules .
a panel said she had a `` lax and complacent attitude towards the rules of racing '' .

turner made the bets - which had an average stake of £ 18.62 - before returning to racing on a more regular basis earlier this year , professional jockeys ' association chief executive paul struthers said before thursday 's bha enquiry .
he said she initially only retained her licence so she could take part in invitational events and `` no longer saw herself as a jockey '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bombardier signs £ 100m trains deal
text: bombardier signs £ 100m trains deal

documents.title: watch : cctv appeal after mountain bikes stolen
text: video has been released of three men police want to speak to after two mountain bikes were stolen from a shed in chellaston .
the bikes had been secured to a metal ring attached to the floor by concrete but were taken from the derby road property in the early hours of 30 november .
warning : third party content may contain adverts .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: church shows off new stained glass window
text: a specially designed stained glass window in melton mowbray has been shown in public for the first time .
the new glass , dedicated and inspired by the town , was unveiled at a service of celebration at st mary 's church last night .
the church is midway through a major renovation which started earlier this year .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: bombardier wins second major deal in a week
text: train maker bombardier has secured a £ 100m order from rail firm c2c .
the 60 aventra carriages will be built in derby and will run between london 's fenchurch street and essex .
it comes days after the firm agreed a £ 500m deal with west midlands trains .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: jury sent out at trial of derby terror suspect
text: the jury has gone out in the trial of a couple accused of plotting an islamic state-inspired attack on britain with a home-made bomb or deadly ricin poison after meeting on a dating website .
munir mohammed , of leopold street , derby , volunteered for a `` new job in the uk '' , in facebook communications with a man he believed was an is commander , the old bailey heard .
he allegedly enlisted the help of pharmacist rowaida el-hassan , from london , drawing on her knowledge of what chemicals were needed to make a bomb .
the pair deny preparing terrorist acts between november 2015 and december 2016
judge michael topolski qc sent the jury out to consider its verdicts at 12.45 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: gritters to be sent out in leicestershire
text: quite a precise figure from the county council .
our gritters will be out again tonight treating 45 % of the road network .
find out what routes are treated on our interactive gritting map :
please make sure to include the b6047 to avoid a repeat of this mornings chaos
well , judging from this mornings chaos , they did n't bother
any chance you can grit the pavement up thorpe hill in loughborough .
lots of school kids being forced into the road as it 's so dangerous to walk on .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : snowy derbyshire
text: still plenty of snow on the ground in north derbyshire today .
dawn sent us this pic from bakewell .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: woman critically injured in markeaton island crash
text: a lorry driver has been arrested after a woman suffered life-threatening injuries in a crash in derby city centre yesterday .
the 53-year-old woman was driving a kia rio which hit barriers at markeaton island following the collision with the lorry at about 15:00 .
she is now in a serious but stable condition .
her 43-year-old passenger suffered minor injuries .
the 56-year-old lorry driver was arrested on sus of causing serious injury by dangerous driving .
the crash led to the road being closed for several hours .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: study uncovers concern over footballers ' medical rights
text: professional footballers ' fundamental rights to medical confidentiality are being routinely ignored , according to new research .
the study , by loughborough university , undertook interviews with football club doctors and physiotherapists .

interviewees spoke of difficulty maintaining privacy due to the poor design of medical facilities , dubious contractual arrangements which cajoled players into waiving their right to confidentiality and pressures from managers and coaches to release information given to them in confidence .
the research has also suggested that the professional footballers association and players agents have a greater role to play to protect their clients ' rights as patients .
`` breaches in medical confidentiality can seriously undermine a player 's career prospects and future earnings , '' dr dominic malcolm , who led the study , said .
`` but medical ethics also serve a greater good .

if players ca n't trust their doctors and physiotherapists to act in their best interests , they may withhold information , which may delay their treatment , and so hold back the team 's performance '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: replacements for stolen gifts being delivered to hospital
text: christmas presents are being delivered to poorly children at leicester 's royal infirmary after the original gifts were stolen .
a train carriage on the great central railway in quorn , leicestershire , where the 370 presents were being stored , was broken into in october .
following the theft , the railway has said it has had `` just over 1,000 presents '' donated as replacements , meaning it will be able to help more charities with gifts .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: gas leak caused fatal house explosion
text: gas leak caused fatal house explosion

documents.title: man 'saves piece of nottingham history '
text: a man who rescued nottingham 's coat of arms from being thrown on a rubbish tip has said he plans to take it round schools and care homes to teach people about it .
michael stremouch , 55 , from west bridgford , was given the coat of arms for free by the team working on the demolition of the broadmarsh car park .
he said : `` it 's a piece of nottingham history is n't it ?
`` i want to know more about it and i want people to come forward with information to help '' .
author: Heather Burman
BBC News

documents.title: all clear for notts bowler fletcher
text: all clear for notts bowler fletcher

documents.title: derby train services disrupted
text: something to be aware of if your plans for today involve catching a train .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: festive traffic jams predicted for leicester
text: major traffic jams are being predicted for a stretch of the m1 northbound between luton and leicester in the hours leading up to lunchtime on 22 december .

traffic information firm inrix has been analyising data , including studies of traffic flow during previous festive periods , to pinpoint which roads will be busy at certain times in the lead-up to christmas .
it says the tailbacks between luton and leicester are expected to be at their worst at about 11:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: breakingbirstall gas explosion 'accidental , ' investigation concludes
text: there will be no criminal charges following a fatal gas explosion at a house in birstall , emergency services have said .
a joint investigation by the fire service and police in leicestershire concluded that the explosion was accidental and caused by the failure of an internal gas pipe joint .
the health and safety executive is now looking into what caused this failure .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: watch : my diy winter wonderland
text: just in case you have n't had your fill of christmas cheer today , this video should put that right .
father-of-three tony mcmanus has transformed the back garden of his retford home into a winter wonderland for local families .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: cricketer gets all clear from hospital after head injury
text: nottinghamshire fast bowler luke fletcher has been given the all clear by his hospital consultant to resume full cricketing activities .
fletcher , 29 , was hit on the head by the ball during a game with birmingham bears in july , meaning he missed the rest of the 2017 season .
he has returned to bowling in the nets , but will now be able to resume batting in the new year .
`` it 's very pleasing to finally get the nod to start full training again , '' fletcher told the club 's official website .
`` i 've felt pretty good throughout once things settled down , but it 's nice to get the official word that everything is ok '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: henry royce portrait to go under the hammer
text: a portrait of rolls-royce co-founder henry royce is expected to fetch up to £ 1,500 at auction after being found at a house in derby .
the painting of the famous engineer is thought to date back to 1919 .
auctioneer charles hanson said it was brought in after being discovered in a house on the outskirts of derby and he thought many would like to see it stay in the city .
he said : `` the company is enshrined in derby 's history - a city renowned for its engineering pedigree .
it would be a wonderful addition to a rolls-royce boardroom or building . ''
it 's due to be sold on wednesday with a guide price of between £ 1,000 and £ 1,500 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: foxes 'in top six under puel 's management '
text: he has made quite an impact

17 - the premier league table since the appointment of claude puel as leicester 's manager : 1 - manchester city : 24 points 2 - chelsea : 19 points 3 - liverpool : 18 points ( +16 ) 4 - manchester united : 18 points ( +8 ) 5 - burnley : 18 points ( +5 ) 6 - leicester : 17 points quiet .
form table
do n't understand relevance of quote 'quiet ' ?
slowly coming up the ranks quietly
agreed
and ligue 1 since lamouchi ?
il est bien la bas qu il y reste
interesting observation
still below burnley
i wonder why the could n't do the same for southampton
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham to get city centre bowling alley
text: nottingham city centre is to get a second bowling alley as part of the redevelopment of broadmarsh .
the alley , which will be run by hollywood bowl , is set to be positioned alongside the cinema once the development is completed in 2020 .
the group behind the project said getting a bowling alley was part of its vision to `` create a fantastic mix of the best in catering and leisure '' .
the city already has a bowling alley on barker gate near the ice arena .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: peak district routes reopen
text: some better news for drivers in north derbyshire .
the a54/a537 cat and fiddle and a53 axe edge are now open .
we 're still working on the a6024 holme moss and a57 snake pass .
we 'll keep you posted with updates .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: council gets tough in battle against duck feeding
text: signs are to be put up around derby 's riverside area warning people not to feed the ducks .
it follows the news four people have been handed £ 75 fines by the city council over the past two weeks after being accused of `` littering '' by throwing food to birds .
in a statement , the authority said : `` we would advise people not to encourage vermin by feeding birds in the city centre .
`` anyone caught could be liable to receive a £ 75 fixed penalty notice . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: soubry slams brexit vote champagne jibe
text: anna soubry has refuted taunts from fellow conservative mps that she `` drank champagne '' after the government was defeated in a key commons brexit vote last night .

ms soubry , the mp for broxtowe , was number of a handful of conservative mps who backed an amendment giving them a legal guarantee of a vote on the final brexit deal - against the government 's wishes .
she told the commons this morning : `` nobody drank champagne , not on these benches , so lets just nail that one '' .
'nobody drank champagne ' says @ twitterid about last night 's vote .
she questions @ twitterid about when govt 's withdrawal and implementation bill will be introduced .
dd says after withdrawal agreement with eu settled .
asking davis and his bunch questions is a waste of time .
you do n't get any answers .
just more contradicting versions of the same !
sour by name sour by nature .
ooh soubry , not sourby
no - sour is right .
sour by name sour by nature .
sourberry .
it 's all about soubry always looking for the main chance and the spotlight she perhaps needs to reflect that moths that get to close to the light get their wings burnt
what has her marital status have to do with anything ?
the rebels should all be kicked out of the party !
they are a disgrace !
she looks like she 's been drinking all night !
defo looks like she 's been on the sauce
ca n't blame anna wanting to sit as far away as possible from that bunch of sycophants .
she looks hungover no champagne apparently
like we are interested in @ twitterid at all
it was prosecco , actually .
did sound like she 'd had just a few glasses of fizz
mps need to eat more bacon
author: BBC Parliament
Freeview channel 131

documents.title: homeowners set to be encouraged to 'grow their own food '
text: a new council housing development is being planned for part of nottingham , with a focus on residents planting and growing their own food .
more than 60 homes are being planned for a former school site , which has been unused for almost a decade , in top valley .
`` what makes it different is we are not just creating homes , '' phillipa mckenna from nottingham city homes said .
`` we are looking to create an environment that is sustainable and that encourages people to live healthier lives '' .
a planning application is expected to be submitted next year .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: us author inspired to write bramley apple tale
text: an american author has written a children 's book about one of nottinghamshire 's most famous creations - the bramley apple .
susan allen was inspired to write her tale about the origins of the fruit when she visited the bramley festival in southwell in october .
mary ann and the apple tree will have its official launch at southwell library on saturday morning , with a portion of any money it makes due to be donated to a foodbank in newark .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: 'lord nelson 's trafalgar shoe buckles ' to be auctioned
text: shoe buckles said to have been worn by british naval hero admiral horatio nelson at the battle of trafalgar are expected to sell for thousands at an auction in derbyshire later this month .
nelson , one of the uk 's most distinguished military figures , was killed in the decisive 1805 naval battle , which saw the royal navy thwart napoleon bonaparte 's plans to invade britain .
the shoe buckles come in a framed box with a signed certificate proclaiming their provenance .
it reads : `` these buckles are presented to alexander davison esq of swarland park as a mark of my grateful respect for the many obligations .
`` these buckles were presented to me by the family of the late lord nelson he wore [ them ] at the ever memorable battle of trafalgar . ''
they are due to be sold at hansons in etwall on wednesday with an estimate of £ 3,000-£ 5,000 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: rugby : head coach to leave nottingham for wasps
text: nottingham head coach ian costello is to leave the club at the end of the season to join wasps .
costello , who joined the green and whites in the summer of 2016 , will move to coventry-based wasps as a first team coach working under dai young .
`` the last 18 months at nottingham rugby have been an incredible experience and right up there as the most enjoyable period of my career to date , '' he said .
`` nottingham is a special club made up of exceptional people and i could n't speak highly enough of the support me and my family have received on and off the pitch '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: bronze for peaty in denmark
text: adam peaty had to settle for third place in the 50m breaststroke final of the european short course swimming championships in copenhagen last night .
the former city of derby swimmer , who now trains in loughborough , was beaten by italy 's fabio scozzoli and russia 's kirill prigoda at the event .
the short course tournament features a 25m pool - peaty 's world titles have come from his performances in 50m pools .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: ww2 relic to be demolished to make way for play area
text: a second world war gas decontamination unit is set to be demolished to make way for a play area .
councillors decided last night that the building , in the grounds of abbey pumping station in leicester , should be knocked down .
although it was never used , it was a block of multiple showers that civilians could have walked through in the event of a gas attack .
it was designed so that gas particles would go straight into the sewer as they were washed off .
people opposed to the demolition unsuccessfully argued that it should be kept as constant reminder of the threat gas posed during world war two .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: christmas tree damaged three hours after light switch-on
text: photos have been shared of a man and woman police want to speak to after melbourne 's christmas tree was vandalised within three hours of its lights being officially switched on .
the force said it had footage recorded on 1 december showing the man running into the tree , causing damage to its lights and branches .
pcso emma guest said : `` the man appears to have caused the damage and the woman appears to be with him and so may know who he is .
the tree is the focus of the market place at this time of year and is the result of a lot of hard work from the organisers .
it is such a shame that this has happened . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: okazaki double helps puel return to haunt saints
text: leicester city boss claude puel admitted he was `` proud '' of his players as they beat his old club southampton 4-1 at st mary 's .
puel , who was sacked by the saints in the summer and appointed foxes manager in october , saw two goals from shinji okazaki ( help them to a fourth win in a row .
riyad mahrez and andy king also scored .
`` i am proud of my players because we gave a fantastic game , '' frenchman puel said .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham 's elizabeth mckenna 'fired ' by lord sugar
text: nottingham florist elizabeth mckenna failed in her bid to reach the final of the apprentice in last night 's episode .
viewers watched as the 39-year-old endured a series of bruising interviews with business experts before lord sugar told her he was n't convinced her plans to expand her florist business would work .
here she is being given short shrift by design company owner linda plant .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: east midlands mps help defeat government in brexit vote
text: three east midlands conservative mps rebelled in the commons as the government was defeated in a key brexit vote .
anna soubry , nicky morgan and ken clarke backed an amendment giving mps a legal guarantee of a vote on the final brexit deal struck with brussels .
it was the first commons defeat for theresa may as prime minister - losing by 309 votes to 305 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: shirebrook to get cash from migrant fund
text: a government minister will visit shirebrook today to give details on more than £ 1m of investment going to the area from the national controlling migration fund .
lord bourne , minister for faith , will be explaining how the money will go to local services and on easing pressures on housing and education .
shirebrook is home to thousands of migrants , many of whom work for the retail company sports direct .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: 'medical emergency ' causes tram delays
text: there are delays to the tram service on wilkinson street in nottingham because of a `` medical emergency '' .
slight delays due to a medical emergency on board one of our trams at wilkinson street .
emergency service are on their way to the poorly passenger .
we are working as quickly as possible to get the tram back to full service .
we apologise for any inconvenience to your journey
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: out-of-control car smashes into lorry
text: police said a driver was lucky to escape with minor injuries after spinning out of control and hitting a lorry on the a50 in doveridge last night .
derbyshire 's road policing unit said it was `` pure luck '' the crash was n't fatal .
a50 doveridge .
a reminder to please drive to the weather and road conditions .

eep .

author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: here 's what today has in store for us .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: one leicestershire school closed due to weather
text: st peter and st paul ce academy in syston is closed to all years due to icy conditions on the roads surrounding the school .
the school added that it hopes to reopen as normal tomorrow .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: road closed for 'safety reasons '
text: the a54/a537 near buxton is closed this morning for `` safety reasons '' after last night 's snowfall .
please do not attempt to drive along the a54/a537 cat and fiddle .
the road is closed for safety due to snow but traffic is still trying to use it causing queues which will delay snow clearance and gritting .
any update on this at all please ?
thank you
good morning rachael .
closure remains in place .
we 're currently working to clear the route and should know more in the next hour or so .
okay , thanks for the quick reply .
clearly these risk-takers do n't realise that by ignoring road closed signs their vehicle insurance is invalid - or is that an urban myth ?
xxx
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: road blocked after lorry ends up in ditch
text: derbyshire was hit by further snow last night , causing disruption on several routes in the north of the county .
a jack-knifed lorry led to a section of the a515 being closed near earl sterndale .
the road has since reopened .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: broadmarsh car park and bus station plans revealed
text: designs for the new broadmarsh car park and bus station have been revealed .
this is what it could look like if the plans are approved by nottingham city council 's planning committee .
demolition is already taking place and the replacement should open in late 2019 .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live updates
text: hi everyone .
i 'll be serving up today 's latest news , sport , travel and weather along with calum mckenzie .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News
